dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/909890852 at Mon Dec 14 14:52:45 UTC 2020

panels.description:
_Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better._
  
### Component Thresholds  
_Satisfactory/Tolerable_  
 * prometheus: 1s/3s  
 * public_dashboards_thanos_query: 30s  
 * thanos_query: 30s  
 * thanos_store: 1s/3s  
 * trickster: 5s/20s

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: Latency: Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="monitoring"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="monitoring"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="monitoring"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="monitoring"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}),
  1
)

panels.content:
### Description

This SLI monitors the internal Grafana instance, via the HTTP interface.
5xx responses are considered errors.



### Observability Tools

* [Google Load Balancer](https://console.cloud.google.com/net-services/loadbalancing/details/http/ops-dashboards?project=gitlab-ops)
* [Stackdriver Logs: Loadbalancer Access Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Elabels%2Etarget%5Fproxy%5Fname%3D%22ops%2Ddashboards%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22http%5Fload%5Fbalancer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-ops)
* [Stackdriver Logs: Loadbalancer Access 5xx Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=httpRequest%2Estatus%3E%3D500%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Etarget%5Fproxy%5Fname%3D%22ops%2Ddashboards%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22http%5Fload%5Fbalancer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-ops)

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="prometheus",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[$__interval])
or on(component, type)
(
  sum by (component, type) (
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:ratio{component="prometheus",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[$__interval]) >= 0)
    *
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="prometheus",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[10m]) >= 0)
  )
  /
  sum by (component, type) (
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="prometheus",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[10m]) >= 0)
  )
)

panels.content:
### Description

Thanos query gathers the data needed to evaluate Prometheus queries from multiple underlying prometheus and thanos instances.
This SLI monitors the Thanos query HTTP interface for GitLab's public Thanos instance, which is used by the public Grafana
instance. 5xx responses are considered failures.

Thanos compactor is responsible for compaction of Prometheus series data into blocks, which are stored in GCS buckets.
It also handles downsampling. This SLI monitors compaction operations and compaction failures.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)

targets.expr:

or on(component, type)
(
  sum by (component, type) (
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:ratio{component="thanos_query",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[$__interval]) >= 0)
    *
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="thanos_query",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[10m]) >= 0)
  )
  /
  sum by (component, type) (
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="thanos_query",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[10m]) >= 0)
  )
)

  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="trickster",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="monitoring"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="trickster",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="monitoring"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

,0)

clamp_min(

panels.description:
Go's memory allocation strategy can make it look like a Go process is saturating memory when measured using RSS, when in fact
the process is not at risk of memory saturation. For this reason, we measure Go processes using the `go_memstat_alloc_bytes`
metric instead of RSS.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        go_memstats_alloc_bytes{environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
        node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring", component="go_memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment=~"ops|gprd|ci-prd",stage="$stage",type="monitoring", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="monitoring", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="monitoring", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="monitoring",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

  monitoring
end

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage"}),
  1
)
